description:
This example shows off many things: for loops, variable assignments and function calls incl. the passing of parameters. 

Notice the nifty lowercase print() function, which takes long strings and breaks them up for you, making it easier to create messages in the alpha register. You can also build up long message strings by referring to variable names mixed in with descriptive text. e.g.

print('Counter ', i, ' result= ', total)

Time saver!

P.S. The only difference between alpha() and print() is that print() adds an AVIEW to the RPN.  Also print() is a synonym for AVIEW(), and would be familiar to Python programmers.
title: Demo 1
